ood.database.exceptions

Class ConstraintsNotRespectedDatabaseException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • ood.database.exceptions.DatabaseException
          • ood.database.exceptions.ConstraintsNotRespectedDatabaseException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class ConstraintsNotRespectedDatabaseException
extends DatabaseException
    This exception is generated when the constraints of the database are not respected. For example, if you delete a record through the function Table.removeRecord(ood.database.DatabaseRecord), and if this record is pointed by another record through its foreign key, this exception will be generated. Note that in this example, the problem does not occur with the function Table.removeRecordWithCascade(ood.database.DatabaseRecord).
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jason Mahdjoub
    See Also:
